alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 5:18PM EDT until September 04 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Clay and Knox. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manchester, Park Valley, Pigeonroost, Herron, Horse Creek Junction, Woollum, Littleton, Haven, Sprule, Fount, Tanksley and Mill Pond.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
